Re: License #: CO190201158
Dear Ms. Tate:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
06/18/2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Tyler Armstrong, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided in the area of procuring available services to
meet the need of initial physicals for youth after intake.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was not offered any consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
2

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
One corrective action plan was created and approved as a result of the Renewal
inspection completed in 2023. The agency was found in noncompliance with rule
400.10113(1)(f) for Employee Records.The previous CAP was successful in
preventing a repeat violation during this licensing period.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting and expense documentation for the facility was provided by the
overseeing organization and no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
A written assessment from the chief administrator is not required for COF facilities.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed remarked they enjoy working with the youth at the program and
feel well trained and supported. They stated the program's goal of a less imposing
and more comforting setting for youth ordered to stay there is successful overall.
The current youth placed at the program remarked she felt safe and supported
throughout her stay. No concerns were noted in terms of basic care or treatment
from staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
Agency walk through completed on 06/18/2024. No concerns were noted.
Discussed with the Chief Administrator changes to the kitchen area that came
about from required remodeling of structural plumbing issues and resulted in
improvements to that area of the building. The program was shut down temporarily
and had no residents for several months during the time period covered by this
inspection and re-opened for residents in June 2024.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
08/08/2024
